full_summary:
# Computer Application Support Services Tender
=============================================

## Publication Details

* **Reference Number:** cb-9-40322434
* **Publication Date:** 2023-10-24

## Tender Details

* **Title:** Computer Application Support Services
* **Solicitation Number:** 10077686
* **Amendment Number:** 5
* **Tender Closing Date:** 2023-11-07T14:00:00
* **Tender Status:** Expired

## Procurement Details

* **Procurement Category:** SRV
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Selective Tendering
* **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal
* **Regions of Opportunity:** National Capital Region (NCR)

## Contract Details

* **Contracting Entity:** Public Service and Procurement Canada (PSPC)
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** 2023-11-23
* **Expected Contract End Date:** 2024-03-31

## Description

The scope of this contract involves providing additional resources to support the temporary workload increase of PSPC’s Digital Services Branch (DSB) due to the urgent requirement to support PSPC’s workload migration to cloud.

## Attachments

The tender notice and supporting documents are available for download at:

* English: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/22976/10077686---npp.pdf
* French: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/22976/10077686---apm.pdf

## Contact Information

For additional information or clarification on the tender, please contact:

* **Name:** Émilie Charbonneau
* **Email:** [emilie.charbonneau@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:emilie.charbonneau@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* **Phone:** (873) 355-4701

Note that I made some grammar and punctuation changes to the initial text. Some changes include:

* Reorganized the text into a more logical structure
* Standardized the formatting and headings
* Made minor grammar corrections
* Rephrased some sentences for clarity
* Added a summary title and section headings for readability
* Updated the description to be more concise and focused on the key requirements of the contract

The rewritten text is more concise and easier to understand, reducing the risk of misinterpretation. 

Please let
